doc.abstracts: Russia's privatization record is impressive and unique. Participants at a June 1994 World Bank conference on privatization and the private sector in Russia concluded that it was irreversible, that the next stage of privatization--selling remaining shares and firms for cash through auctions and tenders--must be expedited, and that developing capital and securities markets and making business real estate tradable should get top priority. This Note reviews the privatization achievements of Russian reformers over the past three years, discusses emerging second-tier privatization and post-privatization issues, and summarizes the key themes in the papers presented at the World Bank-sponsored conference.
